text: Make the rice balls. Stir the sweet rice powder, salt, and sugar in a large bowl. Pour in the boiling hot water with the mixture. Once cooled down knead with hands. Shape the dough. Shape the dough into a ¾ inch thick cylinder and chop into 3-4 pieces. Create each piece of the dough into small balls.  Bring a pot  of water to a boil.  Cook the rice balls. Place the rice balls inside of the boiling water. You know it's done when the balls begin to float. Drain the water from the rice balls and place them in cold water.  Scoop the melon dew and watermelon with a melon-baller. Place into a large bowl with the juice left from the fruit. Dump in lemon lime soda and Korean drinking vinegar. Pour in your favorite lemon lime soda and your favorite Korean drinking vinegar. Taste the hwachae and make sure you like the taste. Add more sugar or Korean drinking vinegar. Put your rice cake on top and garnish with pine nuts. Sip your hwachae and enjoy! Finished.
